intro: Thesium panganense, commonly known as the Panganense Thesium, is a flowering plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as the yellow rain tree family. The plant is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikes. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Thesium panganense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and limited distribution.
